page.title: 01SKELMORLIE:RURAL VILLAGE
page.content: In our 12 square kilometre D-Block 9 are occupied by sea but the 3 remain- ing kilometre squares are the site of our village Skelmorlie. Skelmorlie is situated on the Firth of Clyde in the south west of Scot- land. The village is 3km long by 1km deep,the 3km length being parallel to the coast. The village is divided into 2 parts Upper Skelmorlie and Lower Skelmorlie, by a row of cliffs. Lower Skelmorlie consists of 1 long road,Shore Road. Upper Skelmorlie spreads out unseen by passers by on the main road. The best view of the village is from a boat out in the Clyde. The village can be seen to be in terraces of red sandstone houses,mainly facing to- wards the sea. Behind the village are woods and behind these moorland rises as far as can be seen.
